content.description: Start on the obvious dish at about chest height.  Throw up and right to a nice hold on the top of the boulder.  Avoid the left arete.
content.protection: Crashpad to cover the stone on the ground.
content.location: Park at the same lot as you would to locate the Fontainebleau Boulders.  As you approach the Font Boulders, look to the left by the cliffline to walk between two boulders.  Walk through the opening, then turn back to the left. It is just to the left of Cobbler's Delight.  This is on the Grocery Store Wall just across from the Stagecoach Boulder.

content.description: Start with a right hand on the dish on the face.  Start with the left down low on a poor pebble.  Slap up and left on the arete.  Then gain the lip and top out.
content.location:
Park at the same lot as you would to locate the Fontainebleau Boulders. As you approach the Fontainebleau Boulders, look to the left by the cliffline to walk between two boulders. Walk through the opening then turn back to the left. It is just to the left of

Cobbler's Delight

and shares the start hold of

Suckerpunch

.

content.description:
This is number 2 in the beta photo.

Start matched on a small ledge like hold at chest height under a shallow roof section, gain shallow pockets on the upper headwall, lunge for the ledge above, mantel, and walk off to the right or, more awkwardly, to the right. Presumably a sit start on the large low features would not add anything, but you decide.
content.location:
This is to the right of

Cobbler's Delight

.

content.description:
About 10 feet left of

Petrified Turd

crack, there is a long cobble sticking out about 7-8 feet up.  Match on a cobble and a pocket.  Either dyno up to the cobble (V2) or left to a big pocket (V1). From here, move to an edge just under a huge, broken rock.  Top out onto the ledge.  To top out, climb up and traverse left towards the tree.  The traverse follows a crack in a slab.  Be careful, as the topout is about 20 feet off the ground.  Find your way back down somehow. It is a cool route, definitely worth 3 stars.
content.protection: The topout is high, be careful.
content.location:
This is 10 feet left of

Petrified Turd

.

content.description: Scamper up the jugs to the right of the bulge problems before embarking on a journey up the center of the clean, pocketed face on the pinnacle that visually separates from the main cliff line as it rises. This is an established toprope route that deserves respect despite its moderate grade.
content.location: This is on the far right side of the wall, right of the bulge.

content.description: Start sitting and move a left hand to the shallow pocket around the arete. Balance on the bomber feet, and fall into a small, right hand crimp. Situate the feet, and throw for the pocket jug. Match hands and topout.
content.location:
Park at the same lot as you would to locate the Fontainebleau Boulders. As you approach the Font Boulders, look to the left by the cliff line and walk between two boulders. It's the arete to the right of

Suckerpunch

.

content.description:
This is number 5 in the photo.

Start standing on the right side of the belly/bulge, establish, and gain an incut, right-facing, layback flake to gain the upper ledge without using the seam in the right-more dihedral or anything right of that [this is the downclimb].

Sit start [V7ish] – sit start as for

Bulge Direct

, but use a bomber right heelhook to perform a powerful lockoff to some sharp pockets before joining the stand start.
content.location: This ascends the middle of the bulge.

content.description:
This is number 4 in the photo.

Start standing with hands at an obvious seam/break in the bulge at about chest height, lock off your choice of sloping crimps up the bulge to the ledge above without using the large, incut layback hold around the right of the bulge.

Sit start [V7ish] – start sitting on steep, chossy terrain using a very low, left hand, oblong cobble and a right hand, sloping, sidepull feature with crystal texture, establish, and grab higher, well-chalked holds, move to a juggy pocket, and continue through the standard line. Try to climb as directly from the sds as possible, though it is certainly possible to throw left or lock off right from the start for slightly easier encounters [vars.].
content.location: This is in the middle of the bulge.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
